item.title: Karen add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Karen add a quote by Joseph Heller
item.description: "He knew everything there was to know about literature, except how to enjoy it" -- Joseph Heller

item.title: Karen add a quote by Evelyn Waugh
item.description: "Punctuality is the virtue of the bored." -- Evelyn Waugh

item.title: Karen add a quote by H.L. Mencken
item.description: "I know some who are constantly drunk on books as other men are drunk on whiskey." -- H.L. Mencken

item.title: Karen add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Karen add a quote by Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus
item.description: "When I have a little money, I buy books; and if I have any left, I buy food and clothes." -- Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus

item.title: Karen add a quote by Linda Grayson
item.description: "There is nothing better than a friend, unless it is a friend with chocolate." -- Linda Grayson

item.title: Karen add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "There are books of which the backs and covers are by far the best parts." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Karen add a quote by Anthony Trollope
item.description: "To have her meals, and her daily walk, and her fill of novels, and to be left alone, was all that she asked of the gods." -- Anthony Trollope

item.title: Karen add a quote by Anthony Trollope
item.description: "Of all needs a book has, the chief need is to be readable." -- Anthony Trollope

item.title: Karen add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "Just the other day, I was in my neighborhood Starbucks, waiting for the post office to open. I was enjoying a chocolatey cafe mocha when it occurred to me that to drink a mocha is to gulp down the entire history of the New World. From the Spanish exportation of Aztec cacao, and the Dutch invention of the chemical process for making cocoa, on down to the capitalist empire of Hershey, PA, and the lifestyle marketing of Seattle's Starbucks, the modern mocha is a bittersweet concoction of imperialism, genocide, invention, and consumerism served with whipped cream on top." -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: Karen add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "It was sort of like <i>Macbeth</i>, thought Fat Charlie, an hour later; in fact, if the witches in <i>Macbeth</i> had been four little old ladies and if, instead of stirring cauldrons and intoning dread incantations, they had just welcomed Macbeth in and fed him turkey and rice and peas spread out on white china plates on a red-and-white patterned plastic tablecloth -- not to mention sweet potato pudding and spice cabbage -- and encouraged him to take second helpings, and thirds, and then, when Macbeth had declaimed that nay, he was stuffed nigh unto bursting and on his oath could truly eat no more, the witches had pressed upon him their own special island rice pudding and a large slice of Mrs. Bustamonte's famous pineapple upside-down cake, it would have been exactly like <i>Macbeth</i>." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Karen add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "All we have to do when reading Bleak House is to relax and let our spines take over. Although we read with our minds, the seat of artistic delight is between the shoulder blades. That little shiver behind is quite certainly the highest form of emotion that humanity has attained when evolving pure art and pure science. Let us worship the spine and its tingle." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Karen add a quote by Edith Wharton
item.description: "If only we'd stop trying to be happy, we could have a pretty good time." -- Edith Wharton

item.title: Karen add a quote by Edith Wharton
item.description: "Ah, good conversation - there's nothing like it, is there? The air of ideas is the only air worth breathing." -- Edith Wharton

item.title: Karen add a quote by Edith Wharton
item.description: "We can't behave like people in novels, though, can we?" -- Edith Wharton

item.title: Karen add a quote by Edith Wharton
item.description: "My little dog—a heartbeat at my feet." -- Edith Wharton

item.title: Karen add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "Until I feared I would lose it, I never loved to read. One does not love breathing." -- Harper Lee

item.title: Karen add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I always deserve the best treatment because I never put up with any other." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Karen add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Karen add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I declare after all there is no enjoyment like reading! How much sooner one tires of any thing than of a book! -- When I have a house of my own, I shall be miserable if I have not an excellent library." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Karen add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Karen add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "What strange creatures brothers are!" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Karen add a quote by Francis Bacon
item.description: "Read not to contradict and confute; nor to believe and take for granted; nor to find talk and discourse; but to weigh and consider. Some books are to be tasted, others to be swallowed, and some few to be chewed and digested: that is, some books are to be read only in parts, others to be read, but not curiously, and some few to be read wholly, and with diligence and attention." -- Francis Bacon

item.title: Karen add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "but for my own part, if a book is well written, I always find it too short." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Karen add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Karen add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Karen add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Classic' - a book which people praise and don't read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Karen add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I've lived through some terrible things in my life, some of which actually happened." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Karen add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Books are for people who wish they were somewhere else." -- Mark Twain
